title: Cybersquatting and cyber piracy prohibited
context: [ยง481B-22] Cybersquatting and cyber piracy prohibited. (a) A person shall be liable in a civil action by the owner of any distinctive mark registered and used in Hawaii, without regard to the goods or services of the parties, if that person in bad faith: registers, traffics in, or uses a domain name that is identical or confusingly similar to that mark. (b) Any person who in bad faith registers a domain name that consists of the name of another living person, or a name substantially and confusingly similar thereto, without that person&rsquo;s consent, shall be liable in a civil action by the person. &copy; A person shall be liable for using a domain name under [subsection (a)] only if that person is the domain name registrant or the registrant&rsquo;s authorized licensee. [L 2001, c 281, pt of ยง1]
